text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm suprita A Cloud consultant for
Big Data here at the AWS office in
Bangalore today I'm going to show you
how to scale up or scale out your Amazon
open site service domain to resolve free
storage space High CPU or memory issues
let's get started
note that based on your workload you can
scale up scale vertically or scale out
scale horizontally your cluster to scale
out your Amazon Open Source service
domain add additional notes such as data
nodes masternodes or Ultra warm notes to
your cluster
to resize or scale up your domain
increase your Amazon elastic Block store
volume size or add more memory and vcpus
with larger node types
as you can see I've already logged into
the AWS Management console now let us
navigate to the Amazon Open Source
service console
choose dashboard and choose your Amazon
open search service domain
if you are running out of free storage
on your Amazon open search service
domain you can scale up your domain by
adding more storage to do so choose the
edit button in the cluster configuration
on the console
if your domain uses Amazon EBS for
storage then you can increase the size
of the EBS volumes
to do so scroll down to the EBS storage
size per node under the data nodes
section
as you can see currently the EBS storage
per node is 10 Gib
I am now going to increase it to 50 Gib
the maximum value of EBS storage for the
domain depends on the instance type of
the Amazon Open Source service domain
for example the r4.large dot search
instance type has a maximum EBS size of
one tib
reached the EBS volume size limit for
the instance type of your domain you can
scale up your domain by adding
additional notes to increase the storage
space for the domain
similarly if your domain does not use
Amazon EBS for storage such as if you
are using I3 instances you can scale up
your domain by adding additional nodes
to increase the storage space for the
domain
to do so scroll to the data nodes
section and increase the number of nodes
from 1 to 3.
now to apply these changes scroll down
and choose save changes
the domain now has three nodes with 50
Gib EBS volume attached per node as seen
in the cluster configuration section
if you are facing High CPU utilization
in your Amazon open search service
domain you can scale up by adding more
CPU resources
one way to add more CPU resources is to
switch to a larger instance type
to do so choose the edit button in the
cluster configuration on the console
scroll down to the instance type section
under data nodes
I am now going to increase my instance
type to r4.4x large dot search
apply these changes by scrolling down
and choosing save changes
the domain now has r4.4x large dot
search data instances
you can also add more CPU resources to
your Amazon open search service domain
by adding additional data nodes as
demonstrated previously
for higher stability of an Amazon Open
Source service domain it's a best
practice to have at least three
dedicated masternodes in place
to enable dedicated masternodes choose
edit in the cluster configuration
section and scroll down to the dedicated
masternode section
choose enable dedicated masternodes
select the instance type for your
dedicated masternodes
I am going to opt for three dedicated
masternodes
this is the default setting
apply these changes by scrolling down
and choosing save changes
if you're facing memory issues such as
height JV memory pressure in your Amazon
open search service domain scale up by
adding more memory
one way to add more memory is to switch
to a larger instance type as
demonstrated previously
another way to add more memory to your
Amazon Open Source service domain is by
adding additional nodes as demonstrated
previously
note that Amazon open search service
uses half of the instances RAM for the
Java Heap however the maximum jvm Heap
size that any instance type can have is
32 GB
if your domain is version 6.8 or above
and consists of large amounts of
read-only data consider adding Ultra
warm nodes to your Amazon Open Source
service domain to migrate less
frequently accessed data from hot nodes
to warm nodes as warm nodes are a low
cost data storage option
to do so choose edit in the cluster
configuration section scroll down to the
warm and cold data storage section
select the enable ultrawarm data nodes
option
now select the instance type for your
Ultra worm nodes
I'm going to opt for three Ultra warm
nodes this is a default setting
apply these changes by scrolling down
and choosing save changes
note that Amazon open search service
uses a blue screen deployment process
when you update or edit a domain's
configuration
this means that the number of nodes in
the domain might temporarily increase
while your changes are deployed
so now you know how to scale up your
Amazon open search service domain to
resolve free storage space High CPU or
memory issues
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
